snippet: He has crisscrossed the country and raised millions of dollars. That should subject him to limits that declared candidates for president face, experts say.
abstract: Former Florida Gov Jeb Bush is testing limits of election laws governing when presidential candidacy must be declared, and thus subject to fund-raising, spending and disclosure rules; some election experts say Bush has been over candidacy threshold for months; Bush claims still to be 'testing the waters' despite hiring political team and raising tens of millions of dollars.

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and NICK CORASANITI

lead_paragraph: He has crisscrossed the country and raised millions of dollars. That should subject him to limits that declared candidates for president face, experts say.

headline.main: Jeb Bush, Taking His Time, Tests the Legal Definition of Candidate
headline.print_headline: Bush, Taking His Time, Is Testing the Legal Definition of a Candidate
